p: Acute respiratory infection was defined as an illness of < 7 days duration with ≥ 2 of the following symptoms: a cough, fever, nasal congestion, and sore throat. Lower respiratory tract infection (LRTI) including acute bronchitis, acute bronchiolitis, and pneumonia was defined as the presence of wheezing, rales, hypoxia, and/or chest radiographic opacity/pleural effusion. Respiratory symptoms not satisfying those of LRTI were diagnosed as upper respiratory tract infections (URTI). Community-acquired infection was defined as an infection excluding healthcare-associated infections, which referred to infections newly occurring after 48 hours of admission, or within 30 days of discharge from any healthcare facility.
